verse: Taunting the King of Babylon. The Lord will have compassion on Jacob, and he will once again choose Israel. He will resettle them on their native soil, where foreigners will join them and attach themselves to the house of Jacob.

Nations will take them and escort them to their homeland, and the house of Israel will accept them as male and female slaves in the Lordâ€™s land. The house of Israel will also enslave those who had enslaved them and will rule her oppressors.
When that day arrives that the Lord affords you relief from your suffering and trouble and from the cruel servitude that had been imposed upon you,
you will take up this taunt-song against the king of Babylon:
I will rise up against them, says the Lord of hosts, and I will deprive Babylon of her name and remnant, her offspring and posterity, says the Lord.
I will cause it to become a haunt of the hedgehogs and a marshland; I will sweep it with the broom of destruction, says the Lord of hosts.
Philistia. In the year that King Ahaz died, this oracle was proclaimed:
